intro: Fritillaria enginiana, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine white or gray pubescence. Its bulbs are fleshy and store nutrients, enabling the plant to survive in harsh, dry environments. Fritillaria enginiana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
